>   Advanced Widget Settings

>   The advanced settings for the Calendar Events widget involve:

-   Configuring the sub-catalogs to be utilized by this widget

-   Associating the sub-catalogs to the types of events to be used by this
    widget

>   Sub-Catalog Settings

>   The events in the Calendar Events widget are made accessible through the
>   sub-catalogs of the related transaction function.

>   For each type of event to be utilized by the Calendar Events widget, two
>   sub-catalogs are required:

-   A sub-catalog for searching and displaying records that match a specific
    date event (e.g., LC maturity date). These records are accessed through the
    relevant date in the Calendar Events widget.

-   A sub-catalog for searching the number of records for this (date) event

The Criteria Search Widget

-   Overview

-   Parameter Settings

-   Browser SEttings

Overview

The Criteria Search widget is a tool for defining filter settings to search for
specific records. The search process is initiated by way of catalogs. Through
these catalogs, records can be subsequently viewed or processed.

The availability of a function to the end-user is FAP-controlled: the user must
have rights to the related function in order to run it and access the records.

>   **![](media/dbcc08f02d55bf00c6d727f95e13c20c.png)NOTE:** For a quick
>   overview on how the Criteria Search widget works, refer to the following
>   discussion in this chapter:

>   [Browser Settings \> Using the Criteria Search
>   Widget](#UsingCriteriaSearchWidget)

| ![](media/fd5630d0dacc144d54a805e9a97add45.png) |
|-------------------------------------------------|

The Dashboard Widget

-   Overview

-   Parameter Settings

-   Browser SEttings

Overview

The Dashboard widget is used to access a specific catalog and subsequently view
or process a record.

A catalog – inbox, product catalog, or function catalog – generally represents a
specific type of transaction. Examples are LC transactions that are awaiting
confirmation; Export Collection transactions that are awaiting authorization;
and Import Collection transactions that have been rejected.

The availability of a catalog to the end-user is FAP-controlled: the user must
have rights to the related function in order to view and access the
corresponding records.

**EXAMPLE:**

The Import Letters of Credit – Awaiting Authorization catalog is included in the
dashboard. If –

-   There are 10 records for this catalog.

-   The logged-on user has no access rights (FAP) to the related function.

–The catalog is shown to the user but with no records.

The Exchange Rate Widget

-   Overview

-   Parameter Settings

-   Browser Settings

Overview

The Exchange Rate widget is used for:

-   Determining the current exchange rates of currencies – specifically, in
    relation to a base currency

-   Calculating the equivalent of an amount in another currency

**![tmp377.jpg](media/16dd75492a46553425aa43ac63affd5d.jpeg)**

The Notice Widget

-   Overview

-   Parameter Settings

-   Browser Settings

Overview

The Notice widget is used for viewing the notification messages sent to the
current (logged-on) user.

These messages may serve to:

-   Inform the user of a completed transaction or process (e.g., a completed LC
    transaction)

-   Notify a user of a pending process or action (e.g., an LC transaction that
    requires authorization)

-   Alert the user of a transaction result or status (e.g., an LC transaction
    that has been rejected)

In addition, these notifications serve as links for continuing the transaction
process.

    description of the widget

The Quick Access Widget

-   Overview

-   Parameter SEttings

-   Browser SEttings

Overview

The Quick Access function is used for directly accessing frequently run
functions.

The availability of a function to the end-user is FAP-controlled: the user must
have the relevant function access rights.

| ![](media/032349fa944b2c4b4b2e910a42edbe04.png) |
|-------------------------------------------------|

>   discussion in this chapter:

>   [Browser Settings \> Using the Quick Access Widget](#UsingQuickAccessWidget)

Maintain function. This includes widget profile and advanced settings.

The Summary Widget

-   Overview

-   Parameter SEttings

-   Browser Settings

Overview

The Summary widget is used for viewing the summary details of transactions
through a specific type of catalog: inbox catalog, function catalog, or product
catalog. In addition, the transaction can be directly accessed and subsequently
processed.

The availability of a Summary widget to the end-user is FAP-controlled: the user
must have rights to the specific function utilized by the widget.

The Upload Message Widget

-   Overview

-   parameter Settings

-   Browser Settings

Overview

The Upload Message widget is used for directly uploading a file for the Purchase
Order product, without having to go through the Upload Purchase Order function.

If the user does not have access rights (FAP) to the Purchase Order product and
Upload Purchase Order function, the Upload Message widget is still shown.
Attempts to upload any file, however, are not allowed by the system.

The Welcome Widget

-   Overview

-   Parameter Settings

-   Browser Settings

Overview

The Welcome widget displays the following details:

-   Welcome message

-   Name of the logged-on user

-   Last successful logon date and time

-   Current logon date and time.

The username is provided with a link that, when clicked, opens a window for
changing the password of the current user.

|  ![D:\\NEW TASKS\\2016\\CE 3.1.0.001\\Screens\\CEv31_L&F_523.jpg](media/83080e3acf4222387a330535ec85eeed.jpeg) |

The Statistics Widget

-   Overview

-   Parameter Settings for viewData Widget Type

-   Parameter Settings for jumpFunction Widget Type

-   Widget Graphic Settings

-   Browser Settings

Overview

The Statistics widget is used to display transaction statistics using graphical
representations such as a line, bar, or a pie chart.

It can be configured for two purposes:

-   Displaying transaction statistics based on criteria defined through an SQL
    query. The statistics to be displayed on the widget is the result of the
    query. This is known as the viewData widget type.

-   Displaying statistics of a specific function. In this configuration, the
    Statistics widget can be clicked, and redirects the user to the related
    function. This is known as the jumpFunction widget type.

The availability of the statistics to the end-user is may be FAP-controlled: the
user must have rights to the related function in order to view and access the
corresponding records.

The parameters for the Statistics widget are configured through the following:

-   widget.xml file

-   statistics.xml file

-   Widget Profile settings (for jumpFunction widget type)

Parameter Settings for viewData Widget Type

>   Widget.xml File

>   The widget.xml file is used to define whether the Statistics widget is for
>   viewing only or if it is to provide the user the option to directly access a
>   related function after viewing information from the widget.

>   This file is located in the [Parameter Drive]:\\CE_SYS\\WIDGETS\\Statistics
>   folder.

>   If it is to be used for viewing only, the value of the widgetType parameter
>   must be set to viewData.

>   Otherwise, the value must be set to jumpFunction.

>   **![](media/dbcc08f02d55bf00c6d727f95e13c20c.png)NOTE:** After modifying the
>   widget.xml file, the application server must be restarted.

| ![E:\\DOCS files\\CEV3.2\\Look and Feel\\screenshots\\chartWidget\\Image994.jpg](media/affc9c169b7558cd937fc7f9834af710.jpeg) |
|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

Figure 22. 1 Statistics Widget: Widget.xml File

>   Statistics.xml File

>   The statistics.xml file is used to define the criteria for the information
>   to be displayed in the Statistics widget.

It contains the following elements:

| Concept |   | Description |
|---------|---|-------------|

| **\<level1\>**  |   | This element is the main container where the settings for the widget are defined.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|-----------------|---|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|                 |   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **\<sqlList\>** |   | This element is where the query or queries are specfied.  It has two attributes: NeedFAPCheck: This is used to define whether or not the query requires Function Assignment Permission (FAP) check. Its value can be either of the following: T – If this option is specified, the system adds conditions to the query to conduct an FAP check. If the current user does not have the required FAP for the module specified in the query, the query results for the module are not shown on the widget. F – If this option is specified, the system executes the defined query directly. MultiTable: This is used to define whether or not the query is to be executed for multiple tables in the database. Its value can be either of the following: T – If this option is specified, the query involves multiple tables. The alias of the main table must be set to A. If the value of NeedFAPCheck is T, the system only supports a Master, Event Master, or TRX_INBOX table to be the main table. F – If this option is specified, the query is for a single database table only.  |
|                 |   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |

| **\<sql\>**    |   | Inside the \<sqlList\> element, there can be several \<sql\> elements. Each \<sql\> element defines a set of queries.  It has two attributes: seriesName – This is used to define the legend name for the data group. If its value is not defined, the system sets it using the format [chart name][chart number]. ![](media/be1608a6ddb0234453618855d0bfa427.jpeg) When the legend name is clicked, the curve for the related data group can be hidden or shown.   dsTyp – This is used to define the data source where the query retrieves the data. The data source options are the following: T – This option refers to the transaction data source. It is the default value. A – This option refers to an archiving data source. B – This option refers to a backup data source.  The system provides placeholders for the uncertain values in the query.  Data Source: \$DS is used for the transaction schema. (e.g. \$DS.TRX_INBOX) Field Value: the following placeholders are provided for the fields’ value in query condition. The system sets the exact value according to currently logged on user. ![](media/0c3297a3af2c411b5d1e32446f6c3bfc.jpeg)  **NOTE:** Setting the security schema or tablespace (e.g. CEUSER) as a data source for a query is not supported. |
|----------------|---|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|                |   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **\<xAxis\>**  |   | This element is used to define the description for the query result on the X-axis (for bar or line charts).  Inside it, there can be several \<desc\> elements to define the description in different languages. The default description is defined using the \<desc lang=""\> element. If two results have the same description, the results are separated by a comma. If the description is not defined, the system uses the query result directly as the description.     Example: \<xAxis\>  \<desc lang=""\> \<![CDATA[P,T:Awaiting Authorization; A,S:Authorised; R:Rejected;]]\> \</desc\>  \<desc lang="CNS"\>\<![CDATA[P,T:待授权; A,S:已授权; R:拒绝]]\> \</desc\> \</xAxis\>  **NOTE:** A colon (:) or semicolon (;) is not allowed in the description.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                |   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **\<series\>** |   | This element is used to define the description for the seriesName legend name in the \<sql\> element. Inside it, there can be several \<desc\> elements to define the description in different languages.  The default description is defined using the \<desc lang=""\>. If the description is not defined, the system uses the seriesName value in \<sql\> element directly.  Example:  \<series\>  \<desc lang=""\> \<![CDATA[IMLC:Import LC;OWGT:Guarantees;]]\> \</desc\>  \<desc lang="CNS"\> \<![CDATA[IMLC:进口信用证;OWGT:担保;]]\> \</desc\>  \</series\>  **NOTE:** A colon (:) or semicolon (;) is not allowed in the description.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |

>   Configuration

| **Do the following . . .** |
|----------------------------|

| 1. Open the relevant widget.xml file. This file is located in the [Parameter Drive]:\\CE_SYS\\WIDGETS\\Statistics folder.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |   | ![E:\\DOCS files\\CEV3.2\\Look and Feel\\screenshots\\chartWidget\\Image1002.jpg](media/7d0471fdfecb6dcb0b175a7eae4e3e78.jpeg) |

Once done, save the changes.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |   | ![](media/f3c65b33bd5c7636cfd13691c3503105.jpeg)                                                                               |

This file is located in the [Parameter Drive]:\\CE_SYS\\WIDGETS\\Statistics folder.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   | ![E:\\DOCS files\\CEV3.2\\Look and Feel\\screenshots\\chartWidget\\Image1003.jpg](media/b998971806ba429c8513e0609f3940f2.jpeg) |

| 4. Provide the values for the following parameters: \<sqlList NeedFAPCheck\> \<sqlList MultiTable\> \<sql seriesName\> \<sql dsType\> \<xAxis\>\<desc lang\> \<series\>\<desc lang\>  Once done, save the changes.  **NOTE:** Refer to [Chapter 22: Statistics.xml File](#StatisticsXML) for more information on the parameters in the statistics.xml file.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |   | ![E:\\DOCS files\\CEV3.2\\Look and Feel\\screenshots\\chartWidget\\Image996.jpg](media/d4d889391216fa073ded551fd18dc899.jpeg)  |

| **EXAMPLE: Multiple Queries for One Data Set** In this example, there are two sets of data; IMLC and OWGT. For each data set, there are three queries: Awaiting Authorization Authorised Rejected The queries for the data set must match the descriptions defined in the X-axis in order for the system to correctly map the query result to its corresponding description.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |   | ![E:\\DOCS files\\CEV3.2\\Look and Feel\\screenshots\\chartWidget\\Image996.jpg](media/d4d889391216fa073ded551fd18dc899.jpeg)  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |   |                                                                                                                                |
| **EXAMPLE: Single Query for One Data Set** In this example, only the IMLC data set is defined, and only a single query, LC_CCY information, is specified for the data set. No description is provided for the X-axis parameter; therefore, the system uses the query result directly as the descriptions for the X-axis.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |   | ![E:\\DOCS files\\CEV3.2\\Look and Feel\\screenshots\\chartWidget\\Image997.jpg](media/dc26f72b7e7b7d87373ee257da4991de.jpeg)  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |   |                                                                                                                                |
| **EXAMPLE: Multiple Table Query** In this example, specified SQL statement executes the query to multiple tables in the database. When querying to multiple tables, the value of the MultiTable attribute must be set to T and the alias of the main table must be set to A. If the FAP check is required, the system adds conditions based on the main table’s alias (e.g. A.C_UNIT_CODE)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |   | ![E:\\DOCS files\\CEV3.2\\Look and Feel\\screenshots\\chartWidget\\Image998.jpg](media/c1f1e8a4d1f0037e2cb7d28e9a28f012.jpeg)  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |   |                                                                                                                                |
| **EXAMPLE: Legend Names** To define the legend name for a data group, two methods can be used: seriesName – This is used to define the legend name for the data group. If its value is not defined, the system sets it using the format [chart name][chart number]. This element is used to define the description for the seriesName legend name in the \<sql\> element. Inside it, there can be several \<desc\> elements to define the description in different languages. The default description is defined using the \<desc lang=""\>. If the description is not defined, the system uses the seriesName value in \<sql\> element directly. |   | ![E:\\DOCS files\\CEV3.2\\Look and Feel\\screenshots\\chartWidget\\Image1000.jpg](media/f57215e5c0b5aad64f24d2155db338c4.jpeg) |

| **EXAMPLE:  Multi-language Configuration** To enable the multi-language feature for the widget, specify the langage code in the \<desc lang\> attribute of the \<xAxis\> and \<series\> elements. The system checks on the languages defined in the \<desc lang\> attributes. If the current system language matches a language defined in the \<desc lang\> attribute, the relevant language is displayed in the Statistics widget.                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   | ![E:\\DOCS files\\CEV3.2\\Look and Feel\\screenshots\\chartWidget\\Image1001.jpg](media/caca17f4a0a37e92708c3fb3a79ce3d2.jpeg) |

Parameter Settings for jumpFunction Widget Type

>   jumpFunction.xml File

>   The jumpFunction.xml file is used to define the functions to which the user
>   is to be redirected when the Statistics widget is clicked.

It contains the following elements:

| Concept |   | Description |
|---------|---|-------------|

| **\<level1\>**        |   | This element is the main container where the settings for the widget are defined. It contains three sub-elements: \<functionGroup\>, \<xAxis\> and \<fieldInfo\>.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|-----------------------|---|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|                       |   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| **\<functionGroup\>** |   | This element is where the related functions are defined. It contains the \<functionID\> element                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                       |   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| **\<functionID\>**    |   | This element is where a group of related transaction function IDs are specified. The IDs are separated by comma.  It contains an attribute: seriesName – This is used to define the legend name for the data group. If its value is not defined, the system sets it using the format [chart name][chart number]. When the legend name is clicked, the curve for the related data group can be hidden or shown.   **NOTE:** Only functions with a catalog are supported in the jumpFunction type of the Statistics widget.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                       |   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| **\<xAxis\>**         |   | This element is used to define the description for the function on the X-axis (for bar or line charts).  Inside it, there can be several \<desc\> elements to define the description in different languages. The default description is defined using the \<desc lang=""\> element. If the description is not defined, the transaction function as the description. The value must be set up if functions in the \<functionID\> group have thesame description (e.g., function IMLC Authorize and EXLC Authorize have the same function description. In this case the value “Authorise Transaction” must be set up).  Example: \<xAxis\> \<desc lang=""\>\<![CDATA[IMLC;EXLC;IMCO;EXCO;IWGT;OWGT]]\> \</desc\>  \<desc lang="CNS"\>\<![CDATA[进口信用证;出口信用证;进口托收;出口托收;进口担保;出口担保]]\> \</desc\>  \</xAxis\>  **NOTE:** A colon (:) or semicolon (;) is not allowed in the description. |
|                       |   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| **\<series\>**        |   | This element is used to define the description for the seriesName legend name in the \<functionID\> element. Inside it, there can be several \<desc\> elements to define the description in different languages.  The default description is defined using the \<desc lang=""\>. If the description is not defined, the system uses the seriesName value in \<functionID\> element directly. Example:  \<series\>  \<desc lang=""\> \<![CDATA[AUTH:Authorise Transaction;]]\>\</desc\>  \<desc lang="CNS"\>\<![CDATA[AUTH:授权;]]\>\</desc\>  \</series\>  **NOTE:** A colon (:) or semicolon (;) is not allowed in the description.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |

Widget Graphic Settings

Different types of graphical representations can be used to display information
on the Statistics widget. The following types of charts are provided:

-   line graph

-   bar graph

-   pie chart

The system also provides an option to display the details in tabular format
below the chart.

These features are configured through the widget.xml file that is located in the

Setting Widget Columns

When personalizing widgets, the number of columns on which the widgets are to be
displayed in the CE landing page, as well as the alignment of cross column
widgets, may be configured.

>   Initial Setting

>   To enable the widget column setting feature, the following settings must
>   first be configured:

-   SQL scripts

    -   Error Codes

>   SQL Scripts

>   The following SQL scripts must first be run in the database to add 2 columns
>   in the CEUSER.SEC_WIDGET_LAYOUT table.

(Start code)

>   INSERT INTO CEUSER.SEC_WIDGET\_ INSERT INTO
>   CEUSER.SEC_WIDGET_LAYOUT(C_LAYOUT_ID,C_LAYOUT_NAME,C_FILE_NAME,C_DEFAULT_FLAG,C_RUN_STATUS)
>   values ('8AA7E5236BBB7CBA016BBB84DC610005','column2','layout','N','A');

>   LAYOUT(C_LAYOUT_ID,C_LAYOUT_NAME,C_FILE_NAME,C_DEFAULT_FLAG,C_RUN_STATUS)
>   values ('8AA7E5236BFD69D9016BFD870B0C0010','column4','layout','N','A');

>   COMMIT;

>   (End code)

>   Error Codes

>   Through the Error Handling function, add or modify the 000135 (the default
>   error message for unexpected exceptions) and 000549 error codes.

>   The following table shows examples, which can be modified according to
>   project requirements.

| **Error Key** | **Error Code** | **Error Message**                                          | **Recommended Action**       | **Error Level** | **Variable** |
|---------------|----------------|------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------|-----------------|--------------|
| SYSTEM        | 000135         | Unexpected exception.                                      | Please contact us for help.  | ERROR           | N/A          |
| SYSTEM        | 000549         | Please remove extra widget(s) before reducing the column.  | N/A                          | WARNING         | N/A          |

1.  Add or modify the error codes 000135 and 000549 in the Error Handling
    function of the CE Utility.

| ![](media/5a97d1a8d9a44d8e548e60aad54f4aec.png) |
|-------------------------------------------------|
|                                                 |

| ![](media/366f599b1f40bc5dd19cc847a4779bd6.png) |
|-------------------------------------------------|

1.  Generate the XML files for the Error Handling parameter. The generated files
    are stored on the following path:

    [Parameter Folder]\\CE_SYS

    [Parameter Folder]\\CE_SYS\\ERROR\\DEFAULT

| ![](media/178e358045e6a61f970cd4b2ae83aad9.png) |
|-------------------------------------------------|

>   Increase or Decrease the Number of Widget Columns

>   When personalizing widget settings, the number of columns on which widgets
>   are to be arranged in may be defined.

>   Widgets may be displayed in either 2, 3, or 4 columns. To increase columns,
>   the additional columns must be added, and the user may add or move widget
>   instances. However, when reducing columns, the user must first move or
>   remove extra widget instances that are included in the column to be deleted.

>   Column settings are applied in all widget tabs.

>   ![](media/484376c5e28e6fece5e429cfb2f6d578.gif)NOTE: In CE version 3.3.0,
>   widgets may be displayed in 3 columns only.

>   Configuration

>   To be able to increase or decrease the number of widget columns,
>   configurations must be made to the following CEWeb.war files.

-   column4.css

-   layout.jsp

>   Procedure

| **Do the Following …** |
|------------------------|

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   | **Increase Widget Columns**                     |
|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---|-------------------------------------------------|
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
|  1. Log on to the CE system as an operator user.   In the CE landing page, click on the Personalize link.                                                                                                                    |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 2. In the Personalize page, the selected widgets are shown. In this example, the number of widget columns is set to 2.                                                                                                       |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 3. In the Column Number field, select 3 from the dropdown list.                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 4. An additional column is added on the right side of the widgets area. A message is shown indicating that all changes are saved.                                                                                            |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 5. Add the relevant widgets on the newly added column (e.g., Dashboard, Quick Access, Exchange Rate) A message is shown indicating that modifications are not yet saved. Click on the Save link or the Save Changes button.  |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 6. A confirmation message is displayed indicating that all changes are saved. Click on the Done button.                                                                                                                      |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 7. In the CE landing page, the widgets are arranged in 3 columns based on the personalized setting.                                                                                                                          |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   | **Decrease Widget Columns**                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
|  1. Log on to the CE system as an operator user.   In the CE landing page, click on the Personalize link.                                                                                                                    |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 2. In the Personalize page, the selected widgets are shown. In this example, the number of widget columns is set to 4.                                                                                                       |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 3. In the Column Number field, select 2 from the dropdown list.                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 4. As the number of columns are to be reduced from 4 to 2, an error message is shown, which indicates that the widgets included in the columns to be removed must first be deleted before reducing the number of columns.    |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 5. To remove widgets on the 2 right-most columns, click on the menu button on the upper right corner of each widget. Select the Remove option from the dropdown list. Click on the Save Changes button.                      |   |                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 6. In the Column Number field, select 2. The widgets are then arranged into 2 columns. Save the changes and click on the Done button.                                                                                        |   | ![](media/bb07e94cbf88615a283ca3573d0ce5ea.png) |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |   |                                                 |
| 7. In the CE landing page, the widgets are arranged in 2 columns based on the personalized setting.                                                                                                                          |   | ![](media/3ab1cad2f3253b0ad29d3a008f473e6e.png) |

>   Left Align Cross Column Widgets

>   Configurations may be made to enable cross column widgets, which occupy 2
>   columns on the page, to always be displayed on the left side portion of the
>   screen by default when personalizing widget settings.

>   ![](media/484376c5e28e6fece5e429cfb2f6d578.gif)NOTE: Refer to the [Adjusting
>   Widget Layouts](#Adjusting_Widget_Layouts) discussion in Chapter 9 for more
>   information on cross column widgets.

>   Configuration

>   To enable the cross column widget left alignment feature, the following
>   settings must be configured:

1.  Modify the layout.jsp file that is located in the following path:

    [CEWeb.war Folder]\\widgets\\framework\\layouts\\column2

>   Procedure

| **Do the Following …** |
|------------------------|

|  1. Log on to the CE system as an operator user.   In the CE landing page, click on the Personalize link.                                                                                                                             |   | ![](media/236559f25a6d7a6ca32ce69bb90478ab.png) |
|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---|-------------------------------------------------|
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |   |                                                 |
| 2. In the Personalize page, the selected widgets are shown. In this example, the number of widget columns is set to 3. The cross column widget in this example is the Inbox widget, which is automatically aligned to the left.       |   | ![](media/82d8aaf6a344c5d67b4edac22f223539.png) |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |   |                                                 |
| 3. Add widget columns as required through the Column Number field. In this example, select 4 in the Column Number field to increase the column number from 3 to 4.                                                                    |   | ![](media/3101b7269ad5058048359c61d49f1979.png) |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |   |                                                 |
| 4. A new column is added on the right portion of the widgets area. A message is shown indicating that all changes are saved. The cross column widget remains aligned to the left.                                                     |   | ![](media/7441003f21e067c06445a2b952b65a8d.png) |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |   |                                                 |
| 5. Add the relevant widgets on the newly added column. A message is shown indicating that modifications are not yet saved. Click on the Save link or the Save Changes button.                                                         |   | ![](media/958038729f3e5a277981c8fccbaf0b03.png) |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |   |                                                 |
| 6. A confirmation message is displayed indicating that all changes are saved. Click on the Done button.                                                                                                                               |   | ![](media/14459dcb23e5273381b5aa71d9f84228.png) |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |   |                                                 |

>   Right Align Cross Column Widgets

>   Configurations may be made to enable cross column widgets, which occupy 2
>   columns on the page, to always be displayed on the right side portion of the
>   screen by default when personalizing widget settings.

>   ![](media/484376c5e28e6fece5e429cfb2f6d578.gif)NOTE:

>   i. Refer to the [Adjusting Widget Layouts](#Adjusting_Widget_Layouts)
>   discussion in Chapter 9 for more information on Cross Column Widgets.

>   ii. The right align cross column widgets feature is only applied for 3 or
>   4-column widget settings.

>   Configuration

>   To enable the right aligned cross widget column feature, the following
>   configuration must be made:

>   **For 3 Widget Columns**

>   Refer to the [Adjusting Widget Layouts \> Layout.jsp](#LayoutJSP_3column)
>   file discussion for the updates to be made on the layout.jsp file for 3
>   widget column setting.

>   **For 4 Widget Columns**

>   Create a backup copy of the layout.jsp file located in the following path:

>   [CEWeb.war folder]\\widgets\\framework\\layouts\\column4

>   Create a new file with the same name (i.e., layout.jsp) in this same path
>   with the following content:

Defining the Widgets CSS File By Region or Bank

Different CSS file on widgets may be used for each regional country code or
bank. Different entities may have different CSS style for each widget instance
and different CSS style for widget framework.

>   ![](media/484376c5e28e6fece5e429cfb2f6d578.gif)NOTE:

1.  In transactions, only the regional value of the logged on unit is used.

2.  Even if the logged on has child companies in different regions, the regional
    value of the logged on group is still the one used.

3.  This feature does not support 4 widget column setting.

>   Configuration

>   The widgetStyleByEntity.xml file is used to define the widget instances that
>   are to use different CSS styles either by region or by bank. This file is
>   also used to indicate the CSS style for the widget framework. This file is
>   stored on the following path:

>   [Parameter Folder]\\CE_SYS\\WIDGETS\\framework

>   The system applies different CSS styles for widgets defined in this xml file
>   while applying one common CSS styles to widget instances that are not
>   indicated in this file. If this file does not exist, the system follows the
>   standard logic of using one common CSS style for widgets.

>   ![](media/484376c5e28e6fece5e429cfb2f6d578.gif)NOTE: This xml file is
>   maintained manually, and is not generated by the CE Utility.

widgetStyleByEntity.xml File Sample Content:

| \<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?\>  \<config\>   \<widgets BYBANK="Y" BYREGION="Y"\>   \<widget BYBANK="Y" BYREGION="N"\>MainMenu\</widget\>   \<widget BYBANK="Y" BYREGION="N"\>Dashboard\</widget\>   \</widgets\>   \<framework BYBANK="Y" BYREGION="Y"\>   \</framework\>  \</config\>  |
|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

The widgetStyleByEntity.xml file may be configured using the following details:

| Node Name                                                           | Description                 | Attribute                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|---------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| widgets  - Configure ‘by bank/region’ options for widget instances  | widgets@BYBANK              | This attribute is a global setting for all widget instances. Y: Use different CSS styles by bank (different {BANK} folder) N: Use a common CSS style for all banks. It is the default value.                            |
|                                                                     | widgets@BYREGION            | This attribute is a global setting for all widget instances. Y: Use different CSS styles by region (different {REGION} folder) N: Use a common CSS style for all regions. It is the default value.                      |
|                                                                     | widgets \> widget           | This attribute is a special setting for the specified widget instance. These settings are applied prior to the global setting.  Specify the widget instance name.                                                       |
|                                                                     | widgets \> widget@BYBANK    | This attribute is a special setting applied for the specified widget instance.  Y: Use different CSS styles by bank (different {BANK} folder)  N: Use a common CSS style for all banks. It is the default value.        |
|                                                                     | widgets \> widget@BYREGION  | This attribute is a special setting applied for the specified widget instance.  Y: Use different CSS styles by region (different {REGION} folder)  N: Use a common CSS style for all regions. It is the default value.  |
| framework - Configure ‘by bank/region’ options for widget framework | framework@BYBANK            | This attribute is used to control the widget framework.  Y: Use different templates by bank (different {BANK} folder)  N: Use a common template for all banks. It is the default value.                                 |
|                                                                     | framework@BYREGION          | This attribute is used to control the widget framework.  Y: Use different templates by region (different {REGION} folder)  N: Use a common template for all regions. It is the default value.                           |
